title: We don't make him special
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Down's syndrome
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Handicapped children - Education
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Mainstreaming in education
description: The story of the integration into life's normal activities of a Down's syndrome child as related by his mother. The acceptance of the child into the school community is effectively portrayed enabling the program to be utilised by a school contemplating the integration of disabled students. A positive program that supports the belief that the whole community benefits from the integration of disabled people into society.
